msContents.summary: The Pañcarakṣā corpus ("Five Protections") consists of the Mahāpratisarā, Mahāmāyūrī, Mahāsāhasrapramardanī, Mahāmantrānusāriṇī, and Mahāśītavatī. The earliest evidence for texts grouped together as the "Five Great Dhāraṇīs" comes from Tibetan catalogues around 800 CE, but this compendium is somewhat different from the surviving Sanskrit collection, which is preserved in manuscripts dating back to the eleventh century. These scriptures include spells, enumerations of benefits and ritual instructions for use. With the course of time all of them became deified and five related goddesses emerged. It is, however, important to note that the texts themselves do not have any references to these goddesses. This paper manuscript, dated to 1672 CE is a compratively recent exemplar of the corpus in an ornamental script. (The beginning of the manuscript lacks the introductory story and starts off directly with the dhāraṇī). The extensive colophon is rich of information about the production of this manuscript.

msItem.title: Pañcarakṣā
msItem.incipit: [1v1] evam mayā śrutam ekasmin samaye bhagavān_ mahāvajramerusikhare kūṭāgāre viharati sma || [1v2] oṃ namaḥ sarvvatathāgatebhyo 'rhabhyaḥ % samyakbuddhebhyaḥ || athāto mahāpratisa%rām mahāvidyā pravakṣyāmi sarvvasatvānu[1v3]kaṃpayā || namo buddhāya || namo dharmmāya || % namaḥ saṃghāya || namaḥ sarvvatathāgatānāṃ % namo nam o aḥ sarvvabuddhabodhisatvadharmasaṃ:[1v4]gebhyaḥ || -1- tadyathā | oṃ vipulagarbhe % vipulavimale vimalagarbhe vimalajaya%garbhe vajrajvālāgatāgatigahane |
msItem.finalRubric: [43v5] || @ || āryamahāmāyūrī vidyārājñī avinaṣṭā yakṣamukhāt pratilabdhā samā[44r1]ptā bhagavatī || @ ||
msItem.explicit: [49r2] jānīha bhū%tāni samāgatāni sthitāni bhūmāv atha:%vāntarīkṣe kurvvantu maitrī satataṃ prajāsu:[49r3] divā ca rātrau ca carantu dharmmam || @|| % iti tatra buddhānāṃ buddhānubhāvena devatā:%nāṃ devatānubhāvena mahāti vyupasānte:[49r4]ti || @ ||
msItem.finalRubric: [49r4] āryamahārakṣāmahāma%ntrānusārīnī mahāvidyārājñī samāptā % || @ || āryaśrimahāpratisarā, ā[49r5]ryamahāsāhasrapramarddānī, āryamahāmāyurī, āryamahāśitavatī, āryamahāmantrānusāriṇī, etāni pañca mahārakṣāsutrāṇi samāptā || @ ||
msItem.colophon:
[49v1] ye dharmmā hetuprabhāvā, hetus teṣāṃ tathāgato, hy avadat teṣāñ ca, yo nirodha, evaṃvādi mahāśramaṇa || @ || deyedharmmo yaṃ pravala mahāyānayāyi¦[49v2]na, paramotpāśaka, paramadhātmika, va%jrācāryaśrījñānacandrasya, bhāryāputrapautrā%disagaṇaparivārasya, madarttapunyabha¦[49v3]vatācāyo e o dhyāyamātyāpṛtipūrvvaṃgama % kṛtvā, śakalaśatvarāsya 'nuttarajñānapha,%laṃ prāpnuvanti || @ || % || śrīkāṣṭamaṇḍapamahānagarādhipa%tiḥ
śastraśāstrasaṃgītādi,sakala%vidyāpāraṃga,mahārājādhirāja¦[49v5]v a i
-1-dagdhacūḍaṇamūṇiśakalarājacakrādhiśvaraśrīśrīrājarājendrakavīndrajayapratāpamalladevaputravyākarasya śastra-śāstra-saṃgītādi,sakala%vidyā-pāraṃga,mahārājādhirāja¦[49v5]v a i
-1-dagdhacūḍaṇamūṇiśakalarāja-cakrādhiśvara-śrīśrīrāja-rājendra-kavīndra-jayapratāpamalla-devaputra-vyākarasya
vijayarājye || @ || [50r1] dānaprati, īkalitvara,vajrasiramahāvihāre, śāraṃśvamahāvihārādhiṣṭhita,vāyuvyakvane gṛhādhivāsita,mātrā,vasamuṇilakṣmi, tasya prathamaputra,[50r2]vajrācārya śrījñānacandra, tasya nāri,ra¦%śami,lakṣmī tasya, dvītiyaputrīkanyāpra¦%dāna, jñānalakṣmī, lakṣmī || te sahānuma[50r3]tena jojamānasya svāyurārogya,kāma¦%nāthaṃ janadhanasantāṇavṛdhilastu || dānapra%tijñānacandra,utrāyaṃthanakkahāvayāḍo[50r4] svagṛhe prāptena, dharmmacitrajaya lapāḍo % bhagavati śrī 3 pañcarakṣāmantroddhāraṇapu¦%staka cocakā, || tatpuṇyānubhāvena, helo[50r5]ke sukhasaṃpattridhanalābha,paraloke muktiyedaṃ prāpnuvann iti || @ || svasti samvat_ 792 aśvini māsya śuklapakṣa,pañcamyāyāṃ tithau, anurāṭānakṣatra¦[50v1] prītijoge, pathākarṇamuhūrte, somavārasare, kanyarāsi gate savitali,viccharāsigacandramasi, || taddine likhitasaṃpūrṇṇa || @ || likhiteyaṃ, maṃḍutvara[50v2]talamūlamahāvihāre, vantāvāhārana¦%niyatākhaṇḍacoṃkacche, vajrācāryaśrīratnade%vyana likhāpitaṃ || yathādṛṣṭa tathālikhi[50v3]taṃ, lekhako nāsti doṣaṃ, yadi śuddhaṃm aśuddhaṃ % vā sodhaniyaṃ mahabuddhai || @ || udakāna%racaureṣu, mukhikānāṃ tathaiva ca, lekhata[50v4]vya prajatnena, mamaka śūna likhāpitaṃ || ^ % || śubha ||

supportDesc.support:
Nepalese multi-layered paper (yellow dyed on both sides).
7.5 29

layout.p: 5 lines per page, approximately 55 akṣaras per line.
Double marginal frame lines. Vertical single frame lines for the blank spaces around the string holes, decorative puṣpikās dividing the dhāraṇīs; ruling.

history.provenance: Donated by Wright, Daniel Dr. D. Wright to the Cambridge University Library in 1875.

availability.p: Entry to read in the Library is permitted only on presentation of a valid reader's card for admissions procedures contact Cambridge University Library Admissions).
